com.brightcove.player.display

Class SeamlessVideoDisplayComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.brightcove.player.event.AbstractComponent
      • com.brightcove.player.display.VideoDisplayComponent
        • com.brightcove.player.display.SeamlessVideoDisplayComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Component

    @Emits(events={"addAnalyticsBaseParams","bitrateChanged","id3Tag","openVideo","seamlessEvent","videoStartBuff","videoStopBuff"})
 @ListensFor(events={"account","captionsAvailable","toggleClosedCaptions","openVideo"})
public class SeamlessVideoDisplayComponent
extends VideoDisplayComponent
    This class extends the VideoDisplayComponent to add support for HLS on Android 2.3+ and seamless transitions between videos in a playlist.
    See Also:
    VideoDisplayComponent

      • getStartCapEnabled

        public boolean getStartCapEnabled()
        Returns whether the start cap is set according to the connection speed. If false, the first rendition is picked with HLS.

      • setStartCapEnabled

        public void setStartCapEnabled(boolean startCapEnabled)
        Set whether the start cap is set according to the connection speed. If false, the first rendition is picked with HLS. By default this is true.

      • destroyPlayer

        protected void destroyPlayer()
        Description copied from class: VideoDisplayComponent
        Destroys the current player and releases it from memory. This seems wasteful, but helps to mitigate working with the complex state machines that are the MediaPlayer and the SurfaceView
        Overrides:
        destroyPlayer in class VideoDisplayComponent
        See Also:
        MediaPlayer, SurfaceView
